result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $500 applied to court costs with balance due during probation term. Attorney fees paid in full.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Anger management counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC.
-No violent contact with the victim (defendant's father)
-Defendant to comply with all restraining orders in effect.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

Further proceedings on February 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brian D Nelson in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading of information and enters not guilty plea. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

State appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant appears in custody via video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Defendant qualifies for public defender. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $1000 cash bail with conditions. Court orders $500 cash bail with conditions: No contact with D.N. and to maintain absolute sobriety. Counsel waives time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Status on prelim hearing scheduled for 12-18-14 at 10:00 am.
